Description.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $0.175 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

The Department decided that a number of survivability improvements needed to be incorporated into mission-essential ship and combat systems during their acquisition and modernization. Shipboard fires have emphasized the urgent need to upgrade features and design standards that contribute to survivability.

[P40A / HB003 - EMERGENCY ESCAPE BREATHING DEVICE (EEBD)]: Emergency Escape Breathing Device (EEBD) breathing apparatus for firefighters are reaching their service life of 15 years and must be replaced.  EEBDs address a high priority CNO effort to replace expired breathing equipment aboard ships throughout the Fleet.  The requirement for this capability has been validated by the experience of numerous shipboard casualties.  EEBD replacement is required to ensure that ships will deploy with operational safety equipment on-board to allow for emergency escape from shipboard fires.

[P40A / HB830 - PRODUCTION ENGINEERING (PE)]: PE includes development of technical manuals, Planned Maintenance System (PMS), Provisioning Technical Documentation (PTD), Program Support Data (PSD) and Allowance Parts List (APLs); engineering to manage procurement and material; support of design reviews.

[P3A / HB002 - MAGAZINE SPRINKLING IMPROVEMENT]: Replaces the detection system designed in the 1960s which has performance deficiencies and is difficult to support and maintain.  Replacement includes the Fire Detection and Actuation System (FDAS) and the Motor-Operated Pilot Valves (MOPV).  When the FDAS detects a fire, the MOPV opens to provide the sprinkling for the magazine.  The FDAS consists of heat detectors, smoke detectors for amphibious ships, and associated controls.  MOPV is the same item procured under HB007 - SOPV Replacement.  FDAS/MOPV provides increased fire performance and reduced unit and logistics costs.

[P3A - 2 / HB007 - SOPV REPLACEMENT]: The Solenoid Operated Pilot Valve (SOPV) provides a way for remote control of the Aqueous Film Forming Foam (AFFF) and Countermeasure Wash Down (CMWD) systems.  Existing SOPVs are unreliable, costly to repair, and produce the longest downtime for the AFFF system.  Top Management Attention/Top Management Initiative (TMA/TMI) and INSURV interest due to impact of this item on AFFF system operation.  Replacement of the SOPV with the Motor Operated Pilot Valve (MOPV) is required to ensure these systems are operational for emergencies.  MOPV has a 50 year service life and will provide a significant reduction in preventative maintenance and cost.

[P3A - 3 / HB008 - SCBA REPLACEMENT]: Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus (SCBA) is a compressed air breathing device compatible with a firefighter's protective wear and helmet, and other damage control equipment.  The SCBA are reaching the end of their service life of 15 years and are being replaced with 30 year cylinders.  SCBA replacement is required to ensure that ships will deploy with operational safety equipment on-board to provide breathable air while fighting shipboard fires.

[P3A - 4 / HB009 - FIREFIGHTER ACCESS]: Funds the Firefighter Extraction System (FES) and Ladder Safety System (LSS) installations.  FES provides rescue lifting capability to remove injured or exhausted firefighters from the bottom of escape trunks.  LSS provides firefighters fall protection while using escape trunks for vertical entry firefighting.

Name.@footnote: The P40 unit costs are identified as costs per ship for EEBD.  Unit costs can vary based on the distribution of ship classes planned during each FY, quantities per ship class, and the ship port location. Requirement is for CG-47, DDG-51 (Flight I,II,IIA), LCS-1, LCS-2, LHD-1, LSD-41, LSD-49, MCM-1, and PC-1 ship classes.   PROCUREMENT: Funding includes the breathing apparatus, shipping, and distribution to ships.  FY18 procurement is for one (1) CG-47 class ship (average $212K), five (5) DDG-51 class ships (average $213K), and one (1) LPD-17 class ship ($535K) for a program total of $1.812M.  FY19 procurement is for two (2) DDG-51 class ships (average $219K), two (2) LPD-17 class ships ($550K), and four (4) PC-1 class ships (average $25K) for a program total of $1.638M.

FiscalYear.@footnote: In FY17, EEBDs for 14 ships will be awarded through competitive contract.
In FY18, EEBD's for 7 ships will be awarded through competitive contract.
In FY19, EEBD's for 8 ships will be awarded through competitive contract.

Name.@footnote: PE costs are calculated for each FY based on the fielding plan distribution and installation level of effort for each FY across the FYDP.

Installation quantities reflect number of SHIPALTS to be performed during each FY.  DSA quantities are not shown.  SHIPALT Costs/FY (Qty/(Cost ($M)): PRIOR YEARS(2/$0.894),FY17(0/$0.000),FY18(1/0.588),FY19(5/4.139),FY20(4/3.220),FY21(3/2.266),FY22(4/3.743),FY23(7/6.159),TO COMPLETE(101/140.695);  DSA Costs/FY (Qty/(Cost ($M)): PRIOR YEARS(3/0.345),FY17(0/0.000),FY18(5/0.925),FY19(4/0.734),FY20(3/0.535),FY21(4/0.815),FY22(7/1.386),FY23(9/1.807),TO COMPLETE(92/21.425)

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPALT/DSA:: Installation Name: MAGAZINE SPRINKLING IMPROVEMENT HW

Description.val:
Quantities are number of ships.  FDAS/MOPV costs can vary significantly by ship class, quantity and/or size of the magazines, and ship port location.  DDG-51 ships already have smoke detectors.

PROCUREMENT: Procurement costs include FDAS and MOPV equipment, shipping, and distribution to ship.
  
INSTALLATION (HB5IN/HB6IN): Funding includes all costs associated with the Fleet Modernization Program Magazine Sprinkling Improvement Design Support Allocation (DSA) and equipment installations onboard ships.  DSA costs are budgeted in the FY prior to equipment procurement.
 
FY18 procurement/equipment installation is for one (1) DDG-51 class ship and five (5) DSA for FY19 DDG-51 class ship installations for a program total of $1.632M.  FY19 procurement/equipment installation is for five (5) DDG-51 class ships and four (4) DSA for FY20 DDG-51 class ship installations for a program total of $5.780M.

Requirement is for all CG-47, DDG-51, LHA-6, LHD-1, LPD-17, LSD-41, and LSD-49 ship classes.

Name.@footnote: Installation quantities reflect number of SHIPALTS to be performed during each FY.  DSA quantities are not shown.  SHIPALT Costs/FY (Qty/(Cost ($M)): PRIOR YEARS(8/1.420),FY17(1/0.150),FY18(2/0.595),FY19(11/3.795),FY20(9/3.017),FY21(8/2.900),FY22(6/2.023),FY23(8/3.740),TO COMPLETE(74/45.381);  DSA Costs/FY (Qty/(Cost ($M)): PRIOR YEARS(8/0.602),FY17(2/0.040),FY18(11/0.275),FY19(9/0.213),FY20(8/0.212),FY21(6/0.140),FY22(8/0.313),FY23 (10/0.386),TO COMPLETE(64/3.982)
Same contract provides motor-operated pilot valve requirements under HB002

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPALT/DSA:: Installation Name: HB007 - SOPV REPLACEMENT HW
SOPV REPLACEMENT FIRST ARTICLES/TESTING - Not Installed

Description.val:
Quantities are number of ships.  SOPV quantities/installation costs can vary significantly based on ship class and ship port location.

PROCUREMENT:  Costs include SOPV equipment, shipping, and distribution to ship.

INSTALLATION (HB5IN/HB6IN): Funding includes all costs associated with the Fleet Modernization Program SOPV replacement Design Support Allocation (DSA) and equipment installations onboard ships.  DSA costs are budgeted in the FY prior to equipment procurement.  

FY18 procurement/equipment installation is for two (2) DDG-51 class ships and eleven (11) DSA in support of FY19 DDG-51 class ship planned installs for a program total of $1.027M.  FY19 procurement/equipment installation is for eleven (11) DDG-51 class ships and nine (9) DSA in support of FY20 DDG-51 class ship planned installs for a program total of $5.071M.

Requirement is for CG-47, DDG-51, LHA-6, LHD-1, LPD-17, LSD-41, LSD-49 ship classes.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPALT:: Installation Name: HB008 - SCBA REPLACEMENT HW

Description.val:
Quantities are number of ships.  SCBA quantities/installation costs can vary significantly based on ship class and ship port location.

PROCUREMENT:  Funding includes the breathing apparatus, 45-minute air cylinders, and 30-minute air cylinders, shipping, distribution to, and modifying stowage on ships.  SCBA quantity and cost varies based on ship class and location.

INSTALLATION HBINS (HB5IN/HB6IN): Funding includes all costs associated with the Fleet Modernization Program SCBA equipment installations onboard ships.

FY18 procurement is for four (4) CG-47 class ships (average $459K), nine (9) DDG-51 class ships (average $575K), thirteen (13) LCU class ships (average $75K), one (1) LPD-17 class ship (average $1,335K), and one (1) LSD-41 class ship (average $778K) for a program total of $10.099M.  

FY19 procurement is for one (1) CG-47 class ship (average $475K), five (5) DDG-51 class ships (average $555K), three (3) LHD-1 class ships (average $1,550K), one (1) LPD-17 class ship (average $1,338K), five (5) LSD-41/49 class ships (average $775K), two (2) PC-1 class ships (average $105K), and three (3) MCM-1 class ships (average $275K) for a program total of $14.148M.

Requirement is on AFDL, AFDM, CG-47, DDG-51 (Flight I,II,IIA), LCC-19, LCU, LHD-1, LPD-17, LSD-41, LSD-49, MCM-1, and PC-1 ship classes.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPALT:: Installation Name: FIREFIGHTER ACCESS HW

Description.val:
Quantities are number of ships.  LSD-41/49 ship classes have four escape trunks to be modified.  LPD-17 ship class has five trunks to be modified. FES/LSS quantities/installation costs can vary significantly based on ship class and ship port location.

PROCUREMENT: Funding includes the hardware for the FES and LSS, shipping, and distribution to ships.

INSTALLATION HBINS (HB5IN/HB6IN): Funding includes all costs associated with the Fleet Modernization Program FES/LSS equipment installations of the escape trunk ladder safety rails used in conjunction with safety belts and lifting pad-eyes installed at the top of the escape trunks onboard ships.

FY18 procurement/equipment installation is for one (1) LPD-17 class ship for a program total of $0.153M.

Requirement is for LSD-41, LSD-49 and LPD-17 class hulls.
